title: When is Glastonbury 2020 and who is rumoured to be appearing?
text:
Will you be in the Glastonbury crowd in 2020 (Picture: EPA)

Excitement is already running high for Glastonbury 2020 after tickets went on sale this morning – and sold out in just 34 minutes.

The festival’s official Twitter page confirmed that all the tickets had been snapped up following the general admission sale on Sunday morning – although there’ll be a resale in April if you were unlucky enough to miss out.

Next year’s festival is set to be a pretty exciting one, given it’ll mark the 50th anniversary of the first ever Glastonbury Festival.

But when’s it happening and who’s set to nab those much-coveted Pyramid Stage slots?

Here’s what we know so far…

When is Glastonbury 2020?

Who will follow in Stormzy’s headlining footsteps? (Picture: EPA)

Glastonbury’s 50th anniversary festival will take place at Worthy Farm from 24-28 June.

The first batch of tickets for the festival, which included coach travel to the event, went on sale on Thursday and sold out in less than half an hour, before the general admission tickets went on sale on Sunday morning.

While the festival may be turning 50 in 2020, it only took place intermittently throughout the 70s before becoming an annual event in 1981.

Since then it has taken place most years although takes a break every few years to allow the ground to recover from being trampled on by all those revellers.

Who is rumoured to be headlining Glastonbury 2020?

Will we be seeing Paul McCartney take to the Glastonbury stage in 2020? (Picture:Pierre Suu/Getty Images)

No acts have yet been announced for the 2020 festival – although that hasn’t stopped the rumour mill from churning out a few suggestions.

According to the bookies Paul McCartney is the odds-on favourite to nab one of those coveted Pyramid Stage slots, with Coral offering odds of just 1-2 on the former Beatle appearing.

‘It will be the 50th anniversary on Glastonbury next year so it is easy to see why punters feel as though organisers will turn to Paul McCartney to headline on the Pyramid Stage in what is sure to be a star-studded line-up,’ said Coral’s John Hill.

Taylor Swift is also tipped to be in with a shot (Picture: Rex Shutterstock)

However he’s not the only name in the frame, with Taylor Swift currently evens to take to the Pyramid Stage – while Madonna is strongly fancied at 2-1 and Fleetwood Mac, who have long tipped for a headline spot at the festival, are currently 4-1.

‘Taylor Swift is also odds-on to perform at Glastonbury next year and judging by her schedule for 2020, she would be available for those dates, while we have also seen strong money for music royalty in Madonna,’ Hill added.
